thread.title: Win, lose or draw: Midcoast squads see it all Sept. 29
thread.title_full: Win, lose or draw: Midcoast squads see it all Sept. 29

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Win, lose or draw: Midcoast squads see it all Sept. 29
text:
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Hampden Academy 4, Camden Hills 3 
At Rockport Sept. 29, the Broncos knocked the Windjammers from the ranks of the unbeaten as they rallied for three straight goals in the second half en route to victory. Camden Hills led 3-1 at halftime. 
Josiah Krul netted two goals for Camden Hills, off assists from Zach Pitcairn, while Kyle Crans also scored, off an assist from Joah Welt, for the hosts. 
Nick Chasse and Nick Gilpin scored to pace the Broncos. 
Camden Hills held a 23-8 edge in shots and a 5-2 advantage in corner kicks. 
Lucas Boetsch made five saves in net for the Windjammers, while Kyle Townsend made 11 saves in goal for the Broncos. 
"Tough loss today,” said Camden Hills coach Ryan Hurley. “I need to do a better job preparing us and we need to be mentally tougher." 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Camden Hills (6-1-2, 55.3061 points) is third, while Lewiston (9-0, 71.1224 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Oceanside 1, Morse 1 (2 OT) 
At Bath Sept. 29, the Mariners and Shipbuilders battled to a stalemate. The squads were tied 1-1 at halftime. 
Andrew King scored, on an assist from Sam Townsend, with 10:42 left in the first half for Oceanside, while Zidane McMurrin, a former standout for Medomak Valley, scored with 7:39 left in the half for Morse. 
The Mariners held a 15-14 edge in shots. 
Coby Dorr made 13 saves in net for the visitors and Alex Fernald 14 stops in goal for the hosts. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (6-0-1, 53.5459 points) is second, while Ellsworth (7-0-1, 61.1480 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Oceanside's tie with Morse is not reflected in the Heal Point Standings, thus, the Mariners are 6-0-2. 
Medomak Valley 4, Gardiner 0 
At Gardiner Sept. 29, the Panthers clawed to their sixth win with a shutout of the Tigers. Medomak Valley led 2-0 at halftime. 
Cameron Leach scored twice in the win for Medomak Valley, while Cameron Hopkins and Tucker Prescott each one goal and Jackson Vail one assist. 
The Panthers held a 12-5 edge in shots. 
Cameron Robinson made five saves in goal for the visitors, while Kenneth Moore made eight saves in net for the hosts. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (6-2-1, 42.3980 points) is fourth, while Ellsworth (7-0-1, 61.1480 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Girls soccer 
Camden Hills 2, Hampden Academy 2 (2 OT) 
At Hampden Sept. 29, the Windjammers and Broncos settled for a stalemate. The squads were scoreless after the first 40 minutes. 
Charlotte Messer and Emma Gutheinz scored goals for Camden Hills, while Melissa Reichel and Aubra Linn creased the net for Hampden Academy. The Broncos jumped to a 2-0 lead before the visitors rallied to tie the game. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class A North, Camden Hills (8-0-1, 68.0612 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Oceanside 3, Morse 0 
At Thomaston Sept. 29, the Mariners remained unbeaten as they shut out the Shipbuilders. Oceanside led 1-0 at halftime. 
Casey Pine, Jillian Brooks and Kelsey Brooks scored for Oceanside, while Makenna Brooks, Lauren Hatch and Cassidy Boynton logged assists. 
Oceanside held a 24-2 edge in shots and a 3-1 edge in corner kicks. Kayln Grover made two saves in goal for the Mariners, while Marissa Parks made 21 saves in net for the Shipbuilders. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (8-0, 57.1939 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
